Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: tar

Arguments.Name: --hole-detection
Arguments.Description: Use METHOD to detect holes in sparse files

Arguments.Name: --sparse-version
Arguments.Description: Set version of the sparse format to use

Arguments.Name: --no-ignore-command-error
Arguments.Description: Treat non-zero exit codes of children as error

Arguments.Name: --numeric-owner
Arguments.Description: Always use numbers for user/group names

Arguments.Name: --xattrs-exclude
Arguments.Description: Specify the exclude pattern for xattr keys

Arguments.Name: --xattrs-include
Arguments.Description: Specify the include pattern for xattr keys

Arguments.Name: nil
Arguments.Description: Make numbered backups if numbered backups  exist

Arguments.Name: C
Arguments.Description: Change to DIR before performing any operations

Arguments.Name: --newer-mtime
Arguments.Description: Work on files whose data changed after the DATE

Arguments.Name: --no-null
Arguments.Description: Disable the effect of the previous --null option

Arguments.Name: --no-unquote
Arguments.Description: Do not unquote input file or member names

Arguments.Name: --no-verbatim-files-from
Arguments.Description: Treat each line read from a file list as if it were supplied in the command line

Arguments.Name: -null
Arguments.Description: Instruct subsequent -T options to read null-terminated names verbatim

Arguments.Name: --suffix
Arguments.Description: Backup before removal, override usual suffix

Arguments.Name: T
Arguments.Description: Get names to extract or create from FILE

Arguments.Name: --verbatim-files-from
Arguments.Description: Treat each line obtained from a file list as a file name, even if it starts with a dash

Arguments.Name: X
Arguments.Description: Exclude files matching patterns listed in FILE

Arguments.Name: --no-quote-chars
Arguments.Description: Disable quoting for characters from STRING

Arguments.Name: --quoting-style
Arguments.Description: Set quoting style for file and member names

Arguments.Name: R
Arguments.Description: Show block number within archive with each message

Arguments.Name: --show-transformed-names
Arguments.Description: Show file or archive names after transformation by --strip and --transform options

Arguments.Name: --totals
Arguments.Description: Print total bytes after processing the archive

Arguments.Name: w
Arguments.Description: Ask for confirmation for every action

Arguments.Name: A
Arguments.Description: Append archive to the end of another archive

Arguments.Name: --check-device
Arguments.Description: Check device numbers when creating incremental archives

Arguments.Name: --level
Arguments.Description: Set dump level for created listed-incremental archive

Arguments.Name: --no-check-device
Arguments.Description: Do not check device numbers when creating incremental archives

Arguments.Name: --ignore-failed-read
Arguments.Description: Do not exit with nonzero on unreadable files

Arguments.Name: --restrict
Arguments.Description: Disable the use of some potentially harmful options

Arguments.Name: --remove-files
Arguments.Description: Remove files from disk after adding them to the archive

Arguments.Name: W
Arguments.Description: Verify the archive after writing it

Arguments.Name: --atime-preserve
Arguments.Description: Preserve access times on dumped files

Arguments.Name: system
Arguments.Description: Not setting the times in the first place

Arguments.Name: --group
Arguments.Description: Force NAME as group for added files

Arguments.Name: --group-map
Arguments.Description: Read group translation map from FILE

Arguments.Name: --mode
Arguments.Description: Force symbolic mode CHANGES for added files

Arguments.Name: --owner
Arguments.Description: Force NAME as owner for added files

Arguments.Name: --owner-map
Arguments.Description: Read owner translation map from FILE

Arguments.Name: --sort
Arguments.Description: When creating an archive, sort directory entries according to ORDER

Arguments.Name: --exclude-caches
Arguments.Description: Exclude contents of directories containing file CACHEDIR.TAG, except for the tag file itself

Arguments.Name: --exclude-caches-all
Arguments.Description: Exclude directories containing file CACHEDIR.TAG and the file itself

Arguments.Name: --exclude-caches-under
Arguments.Description: Exclude everything under directories containing CACHEDIR.TAG

Arguments.Name: --exclude-ignore
Arguments.Description: Read exclusion patterns from FILE in directory before dumping

Arguments.Name: --exclude-ignore-recursive
Arguments.Description: Same  as --exclude-ignore, except that patterns from FILE affect both the directory and all its subdirectories

Arguments.Name: --exclude-tag
Arguments.Description: Exclude contents of directories containing FILE, except for FILE itself

Arguments.Name: --exclude-tag-under
Arguments.Description: Exclude everything under directories containing FILE

Arguments.Name: --exclude-vcs-ignores
Arguments.Description: Exclude files that match patterns read from VCS-specific ignore files

Arguments.Name: h
Arguments.Description: Follow symlinks; archive and dump the files they point to

Arguments.Name: --hard-dereference
Arguments.Description: Follow hard links; archive and dump the files they refer to

Arguments.Name: N
Arguments.Description: Only store files newer than DATE

Arguments.Name: --one-file-system
Arguments.Description: Stay in local file system when creating archive

Arguments.Name: P
Arguments.Description: Don't strip leading slashes from file names

Arguments.Name: --clamp-mtime
Arguments.Description: Only set time when the file is more recent than what was given with --mtime

Arguments.Name: l
Arguments.Description: Print a message if not all links are dumped

Arguments.Name: a
Arguments.Description: Use archive suffix to determine the compression program

Arguments.Name: --no-auto-compress
Arguments.Description: Do not use archive suffix to determine the compression program

Arguments.Name: --transform
Arguments.Description: Use sed replace EXPRESSION to transform file names

Arguments.Name: --checkpoint
Arguments.Description: Display progress messages every Nth record

Arguments.Name: --full-time
Arguments.Description: Print file time to its full resolution

Arguments.Name: --utc
Arguments.Description: Print file modification times in UTC

Arguments.Name: b
Arguments.Description: Set record size to BLOCKSx512 bytes

Arguments.Name: H
Arguments.Description: Create archive of the given format

Arguments.Name: --pax-option
Arguments.Description: Control pax keywords when creating PAX archives

Arguments.Name: V
Arguments.Description: Create archive with volume name TEXT

Arguments.Name: --warning
Arguments.Description: Enable or disable warning messages identified by KEYWORD

Arguments.Name: filename-with-nuls
Arguments.Description: "%s: file name read contains nul character"

Arguments.Name: no-filename-with-nuls
Arguments.Description: No "%s: file name read contains nul character"

Arguments.Name: no-cachedir
Arguments.Description: No "%s: contains a cache directory tag %s; %s"

Arguments.Description: "%s: File shrank by %s bytes; padding with zeros"

Arguments.Name: no-file-shrank
Arguments.Description: No "%s: File shrank by %s bytes; padding with zeros"

Arguments.Name: xdev
Arguments.Description: "%s: file is on a different filesystem; not dumped"

Arguments.Name: no-xdev
Arguments.Description: No "%s: file is on a different filesystem; not dumped"

Arguments.Description: No "%s: Unknown file type; file ignored", "%s: socket ignored", "%s: door ignored"

Arguments.Description: No "%s: file is unchanged; not dumped"

Arguments.Description: No "%s: file is the archive; not dumped"

Arguments.Description: Enables warnings about unreadable files or directories

Arguments.Name: no-failed-read
Arguments.Description: Suppresses warnings about unreadable files or directories

Arguments.Description: Don't replace existing symlinks to directories when extracting

Arguments.Name: --overwrite-dir
Arguments.Description: Overwrite metadata of existing directories when extracting

Arguments.Name: --recursive-unlink
Arguments.Description: Recursively remove all files in the directory prior to extracting it

Arguments.Name: --skip-old-files
Arguments.Description: Don't replace existing files when extracting, silently skip over them

Arguments.Name: U
Arguments.Description: Remove each file prior to extracting over it

Arguments.Name: --delay-directory-restore
Arguments.Description: Delay setting modification times and permissions of extracted directories until the end of extraction

Arguments.Name: --no-delay-directory-restore
Arguments.Description: Cancel the effect of the prior --delay-directory-restore option

Arguments.Name: --no-same-permissions
Arguments.Description: Apply the user's umask when extracting permissions from the archive

Arguments.Name: --same-owner
Arguments.Description: Try extracting files with the same ownership as exists in the archive

Arguments.Description: Sort names to extract to match archive

Arguments.Description: Strip NUMBER leading components from file names on extraction
